Albert Einstein: Developed the theory of relativity, one of the two pillars of modern physics.
Marie Curie: Pioneered research on radioactivity and was the first woman to win a Nobel Prize.
Leonardo da Vinci: An Italian polymath of the Renaissance known for his works 'The Last Supper' and 'Mona Lisa'.
Rosa Parks: An American activist in the civil rights movement best known for her pivotal role in the Montgomery bus boycott.
Isaac Newton: An English mathematician, physicist, astronomer, and author who is widely recognised as one of the most influential scientists of all time.
